definition: to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
(bound form) army/military
to dash/to move forward quickly/to bulge/to protrude/to break through/to rush out/sudden/Taiwan pr. [tu2]

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: Development of Chinese literature to the late Ming novels have sprung up everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 中國文學發展到晚明時期，小說創作異軍突起。

sentences.english: In recent years, the sudden emergence of affordable products in the Korean market.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，中低檔產品在韓國市場異軍突起。

sentences.english: Among lots of regionally flavor restaurants in Beijing, the Xiangcai restaurant also expand rapidly.
sentences.chinese: 在北京各種地方風味餐館中，湘菜館也可謂異軍突起。

sentences.english: To solve this problem, guarantee companies rise.
sentences.chinese: 爲解決這一問題，擔保公司異軍突起。

sentences.english: In chapter two, the evidences and the influences of the European ultra-rightist parties' sudden rise are mentioned.
sentences.chinese: 第二章歐洲極右翼政黨異軍突起的主要表現和影響。

sentences.english: The boom about the folk institution of age service gives us new idea.
sentences.chinese: 民間養老服務機構的異軍突起爲我們提供了新的思路。

sentences.english: In chapter three, the subjective and objective reasons of the European ultra-rightist parties' sudden rise are discussed.
sentences.chinese: 第三章歐洲極右翼政黨異軍突起的主客觀原因。

bellwether

to augment/to amplify/to extend/to expand
to aspire to the throne/to aim at (the first place etc)
to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
commercial organization
